Lines infected with 



Methods

Phylogenies of whole genomes can are usually decided on most frequently observed tree or Incomplete lineage sorting or coalescent methods. 

A python script to concatenate all the sequences:

- https://www.biostars.org/p/95337/
- http://mergealign.appspot.com/
- https://www.biostars.org/p/89616/
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16329325/how-to-find-sequence-with-identical-name-in-two-very-large-fasta-file-and-join-t

Another way to go about this would be to separate all the files by species id into their own files = 10 files.  Then all you have to do is delete the fasta headers. Maybe you can do that with around  

1. Concatenate a bunch of sequences
2. Move species to their own files.
3. remove fast headers and enter.
4. add one fasta header line to top
